page.title: 15Woods & Walks-S.Washington.
page.content: South Washington is an area of new housing and industrial development mixed with patches of deciduous {woodland}containing ash,birch,plane and sycamore trees. The disused railway tracks now support common{wild {flowers,}elder and hawthorn bushes. Both regions provide homes for hedgehogs and rabbits and many other {small mammals,}while these in their turn are food for the kestrels which can often be seen hovering above the fields. Rooks,crows,jackdaws,gulls, wagtails,sparrows and starlings are common. Pheasants from the Lambton Estate are seen on the roads in the breeding season.Walks and parks now exist on both banks of the river and the eggs of water birds from the {Washington Wildfowl Park}can be found.
